title: And the winner is? The 2019 AACTA Award nominations have been announced
text:
It's Australia's answer to the Golden Globes.

And on Wednesday, the 2019 Australian Academy of Cinema and Television Arts Awards (AACTAs) were announced, with a few stunning surprises.

In the television category, Foxtel’s Lambs Of God led the field with an astounding 14 nominations.

Actor Damon Herriman (pictured) made history on Wednesday after he earned four individual nominations across the performance categories for his roles in films Judy & Punch and The Nightingale, and his work on television shows Mr Inbetween and Lambs of God

The five nominees competing for Best Drama Series include: Bloom, Mr Inbetween, Secret City: Under The Eagle, Total Control and cult favourite, Wentworth.

The nominees for Best Entertainment Program include newcomers Lego Masters Australia and The Masked Singer, alongside Australia's Got Talent, Australian Ninja Warrior and Hard Quiz.

Rounding up the Best Factual Entertainment category are Greun, Todd Sampson's Body Hack, Gogglebox Australia, Who Do You Think You Are and You Can't Ask That.

Box office awards: In the feature film category, Jennifer Kent's The Nightingale leads with 15 nominations, closely followed by Hotel Mumbai and The King with 13 nods each. Pictured Aisling Franciosi from The Nightingale

In the feature film category, Jennifer Kent's The Nightingale leads with 15 nominations, closely followed by Hotel Mumbai and The King with 13 nods each. Judy & Punch earned nine nominations.

The nominations for Best Lead Actor include Timothée Chalamet (The King), Baykali Ganambarr (The Nightingale), Damon Herriman (Judy & Punch), Dev Patel (Hotel Mumbai) and Hugo Weaving (Hearts and Bones).

The nods for Best Lead Actress include Nazanin Boniadi (Hotel Mumbai), Aisling Franciosi (The Nightingale), Teresa Palmer (Ride Like A Girl), Miranda Tapsell (Top End Wedding) and Mia Wasikowska (Judy & Punch).

In the television category, Foxtel’s Lambs Of God led the field with fourteen nominations. Pictured Jessica Barden (left) and Anne Dowd (right)

The gents in the running for Best Supporting Actor are Damon Herriman and Michael Sheasby (The Nightingale), Joel Edgerton and Ben Mendelsohn (The King) and Andrew Luri (Hearts and Bones).

Tilda Cobham-Hervey (Hotel Mumbai), Magnolia Maymuru (The Nightingale), Hilary Swank (I Am Mother), Bolude Watson (Hearts and Bones) and Ursula Yovich (Top End Wedding) round out the Best Supporting Actress nods.

Expect all eyes to be on Damon Herriman on the night.

The actor has made history earning four individual nominations across the performance categories for his roles in films Judy & Punch and The Nightingale, and his work on television shows Mr Inbetween and Lambs of God.

Who knew? Channel Nine's Lego Masters Australia, which burst on to the scene earlier this year, has been nominated for Best Entertainment Program alongside The Masked Singer, Australia's Got Talent, Australian Ninja Warrior and Hard Quiz. Pictured: Lego Masters host Hamish Blake

The AACTA Awards (formerly known as the AFI Awards) have honoured screen excellence in Australia for over 60 years.

This year's awards ceremony will be held on Wednesday, December 4.

The event will be telecast on Channel Seven with encore screenings on Foxtel.
description: It's Australia's answer to the Golden Globes.
authors: Shannon Shipley For Daily Mail Australia
